author: Hello Fiends
comment: Doesny work with my galaxy s5 with sony smart watch 3. You press the panic button and the app tries to send out messages but thats as far as it gets. No messages or emails get sent.
title: Doesn't work samsung galaxy s5

author: Kevin Davison
comment: I just downloaded this yesterday. My problem is that I can only figure out how to put in 1 emergency contact. I went on today to work on it more and I can find no way to open to the page.

reply.author: Megapps Ventures Inc.
reply.content: The call emergency contact is only one since only one call can be made at a time, but the rest you can comma separate (both sms and email alerts). The rest of your review is a bit blurry, maybe you can use the support email.

title: Seems ok

author: Kandasamy C
comment: The number of presses of the power button shall be 3 also. And once triggered, a confirmation vibration should be included. With these, I would consider 5 stars !

author: Brian Baldwin
comment: Phone side works good, widget works good. Liking the ability for multiple sms numbers. But can't get android wear to activate no help info. Emailing developer
title: Android wear not working

author: Ramon Diaz-Uriarte
comment: SMS location (to receive location after issuing an SMS) option not working? Be sure you uncheck the "Trusted list" or input the Trusted list exactly as in the recipients (international codes and all).
Brilliant
title: HTC

author: Al G
comment: As someone with a potential life threatening medical condition, and not wanting to be continually chained to my home and landline, the concept behind this app offered just what I was looking for. The help / FAQ's could use some work as initially they were quite confusing, not surprising as this is my first smartphone (Google Nexus 5 with LG QuickCover).  New option to put the red button widget on the lock screen is a definite improvement.

reply.author: Megapps Ventures Inc.
reply.content: Thank you! We just added Android Wear support, make sure to try it out, gives easier access to the button

title: Just what the doctor ordered

author: Michiko Alcanzare
comment: Not reliable on my galaxy s3. Unbelievable! And I paid for this!?  Sure they can make it work. But the number of presses in a short span of time is difficult for users especially in an emergency situation. If I can't make it work right now, how will this thing help me in an emergency crisis? I also think the instructions are flawed.   On the plus side the developers are helpful but they refuse to improve the software for ease of use.   The emergency button is not so discreet. Depending on your emergency situation, especially when your safety is at stake, you sometimes want to be discrete when pressing the emergency button. With the size of the screen of the galaxy s3 and the huge button in the home screen, you can't press the emergency buttons without anyone suspecting.

reply.author: Megapps Ventures Inc.
reply.content: Only app which offers this possibility via the on/off button.It is a workaround and as you can see in the video it works pretty well,you just have to try it a few times.Your video showing that you are pressing very very slowly, you need to press 4 times within 2 seconds out of security concerns. We also provide a widget button on the home screen.

title: Unreliable

author: David Clark
comment: One must power on and power off a number of times to trigger this application. This kind of function is not working on the newer galaxy s4

reply.author: Megapps Ventures Inc.
reply.content: It works, but you will need to check out the video. On some devices you need to push over the 4-6 time so we advice to lower the pushes to 4 on those devices. Keep on pushing fast until the icon appears, this is the best indication.

title: Does not work on the Galaxy s4.

author: gary bennett
comment: Junk just please send my money back, this app is a waste of time

reply.author: Megapps Ventures Inc.
reply.content: Contact us over the email. Edit: No contact from the user.

author: George Strudgeon
comment: Had application on HTC and it worked great; however, power button on my S3 will not start an emergency, which is most likely user error.  The developer has contacted me and is helping me to make sure I know what I am doing.  This is a great and I hope I don't have to use it in an emergency.
title: Works great on HTC

author: Daniel Mobley
comment: Tried it out for my kid and it would send alerts for no reason. I thought my kid wasn't being honest and tried it on my phone and it had the same issue sent out emergency alerts with out it being activated

reply.author: Megapps Ventures Inc.
reply.content: As explained over the email the reason for that is that you activated the auto location updates. So once the emergency is activated the app will continue to send location updates until you stop it via another SMS command or from the phone.

title: Don't install

author: A Google User
comment: The Red regency Button does not appear. Emergency response activation does not work at all

reply.author: Megapps Ventures Inc.
reply.content: The button is a widget, you have to add it to your home screen. You can also use the power button as explained in the youtube video, please contact us to assist you.

title: Problem

author: A Google User
comment: So far, so good! I'd add a feature to the test link that informs recipients that it is a test. My first use caused a LOT of alarm!
title: Good

author: A Google User
comment: I tryed it and it works.the navigation is a little off but close anough.but wouldn't stop sending message.
title: Very useful

author: A Google User
comment: Works well
title: Sparky

author: A Google User
comment: second purchase

author: A Google User
comment: Only tested once so far
title: Good so far

author: A Google User
comment: Installed on my HTC Rezound.  At first, the app seemed to generate emergency messages all by itself, without being triggered by me!  The developer provided some quick support, and I was able to get that first problem fixed.  The problem I'm now working on is that once the app has been triggered, it keeps generating new messages.

reply.author: Megapps Ventures Inc.
reply.content: This is caused by the auto location updates in case of emergency - uncheck this checkbox under settings.

title: Having trouble getting it properly configured.

author: A Google User
comment: Having a Pre-recorded phone message that auto dialed a pre-set # and played it would be  needed. Not all your emergency contacts will have SMS on them

reply.author: Megapps Ventures Inc.
reply.content: We will try and add such function, thank you!

title: Pre-recorded phone message needed!

author: A Google User
comment: Force close in case of emergency!

reply.author: Megapps Ventures Inc.
reply.content: Please send us the FC messages via the report button on the dialog.

title: Need improvement

author: A Google User
comment: I would advise a little practice prior to a real emergency, but the app works like it should. Could be a life saver. Devs are very responsive.
title: Works on G2

author: A Google User
comment: 4 times is enough, but you have to be fast. We have a tutorial video here that shows how to do it, please watch it and change the review accordingly if needed, thank you...
title: @savionusr

author: A Google User
comment: Outstanding app, however the panic keystrokes don't always immediately cue the callouts. I'm still satisfied with this for my partner and I.

author: A Google User
comment: This app just went burserk and started texting everyone! I hadn't even pushed any buttons..I just woke up and there was a notice in my status bar and

reply.author: Megapps Ventures Inc.
reply.content: On an earlier version if you have enabled the auto location updates without emergency the app sent the sms commands without the need of SMS command. It was a feature, but we removed it, because of use cases like yours.

author: A Google User
comment: Excellent App. Performs as advertised and as expected in testing. One suggestion, increase the text message character length.

author: A Google User
comment: Sent emergency message without me telling it to do so and freaked my contacts

reply.author: Megapps Ventures Inc.
reply.content: On an earlier version if you have enabled the auto location updates without emergency the app sent the sms commands without the need of SMS command. It was a feature, but we removed it, because of use cases like yours.

author: A Google User
comment: Brilliant! Works great- thanks very much!

author: A Google User
comment: In an emergency I don't care to be navigating menus, and this app fits the bill. I would have rated it a 5, but it seems I must press the power button a minimum of 8 times to make it trigger reliably, regardless of the configured setting of 4  (Galaxy S vibrant). Still a great app though!
title: Great idea

author: A Google User
comment: Cant initiate by pressing power button. Useless.

reply.author: Megapps Ventures Inc.
reply.content: Please watch the video tutorial or contact us to assist you.

title: Not good

author: A Google User
comment: On my previous phone, this was awesome. Current phone (Galaxy Note), it keeps sending SOS messages, no matter what. Something's triggering it.
